comment.author: 89934030@N00
comment._content: It might just be me, but this actually looks like it's spelled Garretty.  Only because the other a's are so clear, that last 'a' actually looks like an 'e' before the t's.  Not that it's a huge deal.. just stating my opinion ;)

comment.author: 43608845@N04
comment._content: The handwriting on his head: Garretty.

comment.author: 29295370@N07
comment._content: Thanks for pointing the spelling out, you're right in saying that it looks as if it is spelt with an 'e'. On the report attached to the photograph, the person who recorded Thomas' details have spelt it with an 'a', which is where the conflict lies, but this has been changed now in the caption for this image.

comment.author: 89934030@N00
comment._content: Do I win a cookie for catching it??  ;)

comment.author: 13316013@N00
comment._content: It is sad that most of these convicts were caught stealing clothes or food. They probably needed it.

comment.author: 36583822@N08
comment._content:
The Garretty part is important.  It's my surname and because I want to avoid work I've started looking up my surname on the web instead of working.

I think, anyone with the surname Garretty is related to me but not so sure after a little searching.  Interesting though.

comment.author: 21554225@N08
comment._content: Tattered and torn clothing on most of these criminals makes me think they were just very poor people too.  And in a cold climate.

comment.author: 53569869@N04
comment._content: Cold, ragged and too poor to buy any clothes...no one should be put into that position.
